column1: Baby Barnaby's////Another solid breakfast/brunch spot in the heart of Montrose. We ordered the "Green Eggs" and blueberry pancake
column2: both tasted refreshing without being too heavy. Eggs were eggs
column3: the bacon was decently crunchy without being too fatty. The pancake was my favorite because of the texture and substance: it wasn't too soggy or hard
column4: and wasn't so thick to the point where you couldn't finish it. The freshly squeezed orange juice was solid
column5: not too acidic or bitter. Parking is limited to street parking
column6: so be aware of "No Parking" signs. Customer service was excellent
column7: prices were fair considering its brunch food.
